title: Nishant Panicker
text:
I am a PhD student in Integrative Systems Biology at the University of Pittsburgh. My research lives at the intersection of microbiology, genomics and high-throughput data analysis, where I work on decrypting the chemical interactions between soil bacteria.
Beyond the lab, my life is defined by the the Indian classical arts. I am a trained Hindustani Classical Musician and Kathak Dancer, and I believe that the boundaries between disciplines are fading—whether in science or art.



Research: Deciphering patterns in mass spectrometry data indicative of microbial interactions.
Music & Dance: Exploring the intricacies of India’s ancient traditions and their modern-day relevance.
Hobbies: Cooking, running, meditating, and spending time on the beach.

Contact Me

title: Music
text:
Music is more than just a hobby; it’s a language I use to explore emotion and storytelling. Whether I’m on stage or in the studio, the goal is always to connect.



Guitar: Rhythm & Lead (Acoustic/Electric)
Vocals: Tenor/Baritone range
Production: Logic Pro X, Ableton Live

title: Dance
text:
Dance is the physical expression of the music I love. It’s about precision, flow, and the raw energy of the beat.





Focusing on isolation, groove, and musicality. Influenced by old school and modern urban styles.



Exploring fluidity and narrative through movement.











TipWatch



Videos of recent performances will be uploaded here shortly.



“Dance is the hidden language of the soul.”

title: Research
text:
Research Focus
My work revolves around decrypting how soil microorganisms communicate through a wide variety of small molecules. This chemical language is essential for understanding their functional roles and ecological dynamics.
I utilize a 3D printed platform and high-throughput mass spectrometry to eavesdrop on interactions between pairs of bacteria. This allows me to infer the context-specific language of microbial communication for a large panel of soil bacteria.


Education

University of Pittsburgh
PhD in Integrative Systems Biology | In Progress


Azim Premji University
B.Sc. in Biology (Minor in Data Science) | 2020



Representative Publications

Adhikari, A., Goregaonkar, N., Narayanan, R., Panicker, N., & Ramamoorthy, N. (2020).
“Manufactured Maladies: Lives and Livelihoods of Migrant Workers During COVID-19 Lockdown in India.”
The Indian Journal of Labour Economics, 63(4), 969-997.
